perturbation.original_text: 8.5 Distributor will comply with all applicable commercial and public anti-bribery laws, including, without limitation, the UK's Bribery Act  2010 and the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 ("Anti-Bribery Laws"), which prohibit (amongst other things) corrupt offers of  anything of value, either directly or indirectly, to a government official to obtain or keep business. ''Government officials" include any  government employee, candidate for public office, and employee of government-owned or government-controlled companies, public  international organisations, and political parties. Furthermore, Distributor will not make any facilitation payments, which are payments to  induce officials to perform routine functions they are otherwise obligated to perform.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.13 Miscellaneous Compliance. Distributor will comply with all applicable commercial and public anti-bribery laws, including, without limitation, the UK's Bribery Act  2010 and the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 ("Anti-Bribery Laws"), which prohibit (amongst other things) corrupt offers of  anything of value, either directly or indirectly, to a government official to obtain or keep business. ''Government officials" include any  government employee, candidate for public office, and employee of government-owned or government-controlled companies, public  international organisations, and political parties. Furthermore, Distributor will not make any facilitation payments, which are payments to  induce officials to perform routine functions they are otherwise obligated to perform.
perturbation.explanation: The original anti-bribery clause is moved from the warranties section to a newly created 'Miscellaneous Compliance' section at the end of the agreement, diminishing its perceived importance and connection to the distributor's performance warranties, making it harder to enforce.
perturbation.contradicted_law: UK Bribery Act 2010, U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977

perturbation.original_text: 11.5 Compliance with Export Laws. Distributor shall comply with all applicable export and re-export control laws and regulations ("Export  Laws"), which the parties agree include: (a) the Export Administration Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of Commerce, (b)  trade and economic sanctions maintained by the U.S. Treasury Department's Office of Foreign Assets Control, and (c) the International  Traffic in Arms Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of State. Unless Distributor obtains prior authorisation required by  applicable Export Laws, Distributor shall not export any Product to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan or Syria.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.10 Compliance with Export Laws. Distributor shall comply with all applicable export and re-export control laws and regulations ("Export  Laws"), which the parties agree include: (a) the Export Administration Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of Commerce, (b)  trade and economic sanctions maintained by the U.S. Treasury Department's Office of Foreign Assets Control, and (c) the International  Traffic in Arms Regulations maintained by the U.S. Department of State. Unless Distributor obtains prior authorisation required by  applicable Export Laws, Distributor shall not export any Product to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan or Syria.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the export law compliance clause from the 'General' section to the 'Distribution and Other Obligations' section, makes it seem less general and more specifically tied to distribution activities, potentially limiting its applicability to other aspects of the agreement and making it harder to enforce broadly.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Export Administration Regulations, International Traffic in Arms Regulations

perturbation.original_text:
10.1 Google [ * ] and will indemnify Distributor against all liabilities, costs, damages and expenses (including settlement costs approved in  writing by Google and reasonable legal fees [ * ]) suffered or incurred by Distributor arising from any claim from a third party that any  Products or any Google Trademark infringe(s) any copyright, trade secret or trademark of such third party (an "IP Claim"), provided that  Distributor:

  (a) promptly notifies Google;

  (b) provides Google with reasonable information, assistance and cooperation in responding to and, where applicable, defending  such IP Claim; and

  (c) gives Google full control and sole authority over the defence and settlement of such IP Claim. Distributor may appoint its own  supervising counsel of its choice at its own expense.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.7 Google [ * ] and will indemnify Distributor against all liabilities, costs, damages and expenses (including settlement costs approved in  writing by Google and reasonable legal fees [ * ]) suffered or incurred by Distributor arising from any claim from a third party that any  Products or any Google Trademark infringe(s) any copyright, trade secret or trademark of such third party (an "IP Claim"), provided that  Distributor:

  (a) promptly notifies Google;

  (b) provides Google with reasonable information, assistance and cooperation in responding to and, where applicable, defending  such IP Claim; and

  (c) agrees to limit any claim to a maximum of $100. Distributor may appoint its own  supervising counsel of its choice at its own expense.
perturbation.explanation: Clause 10.1 which is where Google Indeminifies Distributor for IP claims has been moved to the section concerning License Grants and Restrictions. The added language of limiting any claim to a maximum of $100.00 goes against what an indemnification clause is, as Indemnification is meant to be the complete compensation for damages or losses.
